pullrequest.title: posterior compatibility with sublabel output mode

content.raw:
Do you have to math-it-out to figure out which bed file refers to which "full" label and sublabel output? For example with a bedGraph file name of "103" and 17 labels and 9 sublabels is there a simple way to discover which label & sublabel "103" refers to?
No matter what naming scheme is ultimately decided on, the segway documentation (segway.rst) needs to be updated as well explaining this.
content.html: Do you have to math-it-out to figure out which bed file refers to which "full" label and sublabel output? For example with a bedGraph file name of "103" and 17 labels and 9 sublabels is there a simple way to discover which label & sublabel "103" refers to? No matter what naming scheme is ultimately decided on, the segway documentation (segway.rst) needs to be updated as well explaining this.

pull_request.title: posterior compatibility with sublabel output mode

update.description:
A previous pull request made the --output-label option control the output of the viterbi task, and this makes it work with the posterior task as well. In my testing this does not change segway's behavior unless the posterior task is specified, and output-label is not set to "seg". In sublabel output mode, the labels are printed according to the option in the posterior_code file, and separate posterior bed (and bedGraph) files are created for each sublabel. The "full" output mode (e.g. "0.1" for label 0 sublabel 1) seems a bit confusing for the bedGraph filenames, which already have periods in them, so I set the filenames to just be by sublabel (so for 2 labels and 2 sublabels, the bed files have names 0 through 3).

There is a minor change to a couple touchstone files to account for the fact that the num_subsegs variable is now passed to segway-task.
update.title: posterior compatibility with sublabel output mode
